clinical_summary: Serial laboratory evaluations from November to December 2025 show generally normal complete blood counts with a normocytic, normochromic red cell morphology, normal white blood cell and platelet counts, and normal differential percentages; a slight reduction in MCV (81.8 fL) and MCH (26.7 pg) was noted on 2025-11-07. Liver function tests on 2025-12-15 revealed normal transaminases (ALT 10 U/L, AST 12 U/L) but a mild elevation of total bilirubin (1.4 mg/dL) and direct bilirubin (0.6 mg/dL) with indirect bilirubin at the upper reference limit (0.8 mg/dL). Inflammatory markers were within normal limits (CRP 1.8 mg/L, procalcitonin 0.13 ng/mL). The peripheral smear was reported as normal in both reports.

differential_diagnoses.name: Gilbert syndrome
differential_diagnoses.justification: Mildly elevated indirect bilirubin (0.8 mg/dL) with normal liver enzymes suggests a benign unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia.

differential_diagnoses.name: Early cholestatic or hepatobiliary disorder
differential_diagnoses.justification: Isolated direct bilirubin elevation (0.6 mg/dL) despite normal ALT and AST may indicate early biliary dysfunction.

differential_diagnoses.name: Thalassemia trait or iron deficiency anemia
differential_diagnoses.justification: Low MCV (81.8 fL) and MCH (26.7 pg) with normal hemoglobin point toward a microcytic process such as thalassemia trait or early iron deficiency.

differential_diagnoses.name: Subclinical hemolysis
differential_diagnoses.justification: Upper‑limit indirect bilirubin with normal hemoglobin could reflect low‑grade hemolysis.
